marketNews.title: US Attacks Iran, Strait of Hormuz Potentially to be Closed
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, announced on Sunday (22/6) that the US military had attacked 3 Iranian nuclear facilities, marking direct US involvement in the conflict between Israel and Iran. This attack occurred only 3 days after the White House spokesperson mentioned that the US decision to attack Iran would only be determined in the next 2 weeks. In response to the US attack, the Iranian parliament reportedly supports a plan to close the Strait of Hormuz, which is a shipping lane for about 20% of global oil supplies daily. Nevertheless, the final decision to close the strait rests with Iran's national security council. US Secretary of State, Marco Rubio, said on Sunday (22/6) that he had contacted the Chinese government to prevent Iran from closing the Strait of Hormuz. China is currently the largest oil importer from Iran, with imports reaching more than 1.8 million barrels per day in May 2025, according to data from ship tracking company Vortexa. As of this writing, Iran has not launched a retaliatory strike against the US. However, Iranian Foreign Minister, Abbas Araghchi, stated that his country is considering all options to respond to the attack. On the other hand, Trump warned that if Iran retaliates against US assets, the US will respond with greater force than the initial attack. According to a Bloomberg report, Iran currently has no alliances to fight the US, although several countries such as China and Russia have condemned the US attack on Iran. Abbas said he would meet with Russian President, Vladimir Putin, on Monday (23/6), but Bloomberg reported that military assistance from China and Russia would be difficult to provide due to the lack of formal military relations with Iran. Meanwhile, only the Houthis, a militant proxy group, have shown support for Iran, having announced threats targeting US commercial and naval vessels.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Responding to these developments, Brent futures for the September 2025 contract briefly surged +5.2% to 79.4 US dollars per barrel today, Monday (23/6), before finally falling to the 76.1 US dollars intraday level (+0.8%) following the absence of an immediate concrete response from Iran, indicating that oil supply from the Middle East remains uninterrupted amid the conflict escalation. Meanwhile, the স্টক market reacted muted by this afternoon, with Nikkei -0.13%, EUROSTOXX50 -0.44%, and S&P Futures -0.05%. Meanwhile, IHSG fell -1.74%, although this was more caused by significant declines in several large market cap stocks such as $DSSA (-5.91%), $BREN (-4.13%), and $BBRI (-1.85%). We assess that the market is still waiting to see how far Iran can respond to the US attack before prices react further, so this needs to be closely monitored by investors.

marketNews.title: BUMI Targets Wolfram Mine to Operate in 2026
marketNews.content: 1. $BUMI: Bisnis reported that Vice President Investor Relations & Chief Economist Bumi Resources, Achmad Reza Widjaja, said the Wolfram Limited mine is expected to commence operations in 2026, although he did not elaborate further. Reza also mentioned that the company targets non-coal revenue to contribute 50% of the company's total revenue by 2030. Previously, BUMI stated in an information disclosure that the completion of the transaction for the acquisition of Wolfram Limited - which is engaged in copper and gold mining - is still awaiting approval from the Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB) in Australia. 2. $BREN: Barito Renewables Energy signed a credit facility of up to 121.1 million US dollars from DBS Bank Ltd. and SMBC with a tenor up to June 18, 2030. This facility is intended to finance capacity expansion of 47 MW through the retrofit project of Darajat Geothermal Power Plant unit 3 and the construction of Salak Geothermal Power Plant unit 7. 3. $LSIP: PP London Sumatra Indonesia will distribute 2024 financial year dividends amounting to approximately 443 billion rupiah or 65 rupiah per share. This amount equals a 30% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 35%) and indicates a dividend yield of approximately 5.4% as of Monday (23/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 30, 2025, while payment is on July 18, 2025. 4. $HRUM: A Director of Harum Energy, Steven Scott Barki, purchased approximately 11.5 million HRUM shares at an average price of 835 rupiah per share on June 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 9.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Steven Scott Barki's ownership in HRUM increased from none to 0.085%. 5. $CLPI: Colorpak Indonesia will distribute 2024 financial year dividends amounting to approximately 42.6 billion rupiah or 139.21 rupiah per share. This amount equals approximately 76% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: approximately 75%) and indicates a dividend yield of approximately 10.7% as of Monday (23/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 26, 2025, while payment is on July 18, 2025. 6. $NICL: PAM Mineral controller, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, purchased approximately 7.7 million NICL shares at an average price of approximately 1,118 rupiah per share on 19-20 June 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.308% to 0.38%. 7. $DLTA: Delta Djakarta will distribute 2024 financial year dividends amounting to approximately 138 billion rupiah or 172 rupiah per share. This amount equals a 97% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 113%) and indicates a dividend yield of approximately 8.1% as of Monday (23/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 30, 2025, while payment is on July 18, 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content: 1. Bank Indonesia noted that economic liquidity or broad money supply (M2) in May 2025 grew +4.9% YoY to 9,406.6 trillion rupiah (vs. Apr 2025: +5.2% YoY). 2. The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina ($HEAL), Hasmoro, purchased 724,600 HEAL shares at a price of 1,380 rupiah per share on June 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hasmoro's direct ownership in HEAL increased from 4.7996% to 4.8044%. 3. Vice Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Yuliot Tanjung, stated on Friday (20/6) that the government is considering an option for industries to import gas independently if domestic gas supply cannot meet demand. 4. Head of the Bureau of Communication and Public Information of the Ministry of Transportation, Ernita Titis Dewi, stated on Sunday (22/6) that the government's plan to implement zero ODOL (Over Dimension Over Load) is currently being formulated involving cross-ministries and agencies. The government targets that by 2026 there will be no more overweight and oversized vehicles. Ernita explained that the warning stage will be enforced in July 2025, with law enforcement starting from August 2025. 5. Head of BMKG, Dwikorita Karnawati, stated on Saturday (21/6) that most regions in Indonesia will experience a shorter dry season than forecast this year, driven by higher than usual rainfall. This is expected to boost rice harvest in Indonesia. BMKG previously predicted the dry season would be normal this year, starting in April 2025 in most regions and peaking in June-August 2025. 6. Bank DKI management on Sunday (22/6) performed a rebranding of its name and logo to Bank Jakarta. On the same occasion, the Governor of DKI Jakarta, Pramono Anung Wibowo, tasked the management of Bank Jakarta to go public (IPO) in 2026.

marketNews.title: Iran, America, and False Narratives?
marketNews.content: "War is just a theme to move the market." - ricky2212
